bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, December 14, 1886
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate of the United States Monrovia Dec. 14, '86
To the assistant Secy. of State,
Despatch No. 14. Message of the President.
Reception of despatch No. 14 dated Nov. 3rd '86, Message of the President of the Republic of Liberia to the Legislature.
Consulate of the United States Monrovia Dec. 14, 86
Hon. J. D. Porter, Assistant Secy. of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor most respectfully to inform you that your despatch No. 14 dated Nov. 3rd 1886 received, I have the honor also to inform the Department that the President of the Republic of Liberia delievered his message today to the Legislature of Liberia in
I have the honor to be Sir Your obedient Servant
Samuel S. Sevier Acting Consul Gen.
Hon. J. D. Porter Assistant Secy of State Washington D.C.
